problem.markdown:
>>The total arrival rate at a given node is found by summing: <<
[x] New items arriving to the given node from outside the network. [ ] Items that stayed at the given node. [x] Items that travel to the given node from other nodes in the network.
[explanation] Refer to the expression in slide 91 for the total arrival rate at a node i, \(\lambda_i\), such that \(\lambda_i = \alpha_i + \sum_{j}p_{ji}\lambda_j\). The first term refers items arriving from outside the network and the second term (summation) refers to items arriving from other nodes in the network.
[explanation]
